definition: The term "voneinander" refers to the concept of separation or distance between multiple entities. It is commonly used to describe the idea of things being apart or distinct from each other. This word is often employed to express the notion of mutual exclusion or the lack of connection between various elements.

examples.english: They can learn from each other.
The two are dependent on each other.
They have moved away from each other.

examples.german: Die beiden haben sich voneinander verabschiedet.
examples.english: The two said goodbye to each other.
They are separated from each other.
